articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: RPT-China Dec factory activity expands more slowly but confidence jumps-Caixin PMI
articles.content:
(Repeats to attach to alert) 
* Caixin Dec factory PMI eases from Nov, misses analyst forecasts 
* New order growth softens, employment stagnates 
* But export orders remain solid, business confidence up 
* Points to wobbly recovery in manufacturing secto… [+3553 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Citrus: No. 13 Alabama cruises past No. 14 Michigan
articles.description: EditorsNote: Corrects to "six" seasons in graf 3; adds reference to injured Tua Tagovailoa in graf 4; other minor edits'
articles.content:
EditorsNote: Corrects to “six” seasons in graf 3; adds reference to injured Tua Tagovailoa in graf 4; other minor edits 
Mac Jones threw for 327 yards and three touchdowns and No. 13 Alabama pulled away to a 35-16 win over No. 14 Michigan in the Citrus Bowl … [+1989 chars]

articles.author: Nikhil Subba
articles.title: Australia shares rise on healthcare, technology gains
articles.description: Australian shares inched higher on Thursday on their first trading day of the year, led by gains in healthcare and tech sectors amid thin trading volumes.'
articles.content:
* Afterpay among top boosts to benchmark 
* Financials temper broader gains 
* NZ closed on Thursday 
By Nikhil Subba 
Jan 2 (Reuters) - Australian shares inched higher on Thursday on their first trading day of the year, led by gains in healthcare and tec… [+2045 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Irish factory activity shrinks slightly in December: PMI
articles.description: Irish factory activity contracted slightly in December due to tumbling orders from overseas and sluggish hiring, a survey showed on Thursday.'
articles.content:
DUBLIN (Reuters) - Irish factory activity contracted slightly in December due to tumbling orders from overseas and sluggish hiring, a survey showed on Thursday. 
The AIB IHS Markit Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for the manufacturing sector edged down to 4… [+938 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Military moves in to help mass-scale evacuation from Australian bushfires
articles.description: Tens of thousands of holiday makers raced to evacuate popular seaside towns on Australia's east coast on Wednesday, fleeing ahead of advancing bushfires, as military ships and helicopters planned missions to rescue thousands more trapped by the blazes.
articles.content: MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Tens of thousands of holiday makers raced to evacuate popular seaside towns on Australia’s east coast on Wednesday, fleeing ahead of advancing bushfires, as military ships and helicopters planned missions to rescue thousands more trapped… [+3240 chars]

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.title: RPT-Surveillance in a leafy enclave, Ghosn's Tokyo life was under strict monitoring
articles.description: The imposing home where Carlos Ghosn lived for the last seven months and probably launched a daring escape to avoid Japanese prosecutors is nestled in a leafy enclave of Tokyo where most people pay little attention to Westerners or luxury cars.
articles.content:
(Repeats item first carried on Wednesday) 
By Tim Kelly and Maki Shiraki 
TOKYO, Jan 1 (Reuters) - The imposing home where Carlos Ghosn lived for the last seven months and probably launched a daring escape to avoid Japanese prosecutors is nestled in a leafy… [+3335 chars]

articles.author: Linda Sieg
articles.title: RPT-Ghosn flight prompts talk of more curbs in Japan's strict justice system
articles.description: Carlos Ghosn's daring flight from Japan, where he was awaiting trial on charges of financial wrongdoing, has revived global criticism of the nation's "hostage justice," but in Japan is prompting talk of reversing more lenient curbs on defendants.
articles.content:
(Repeats item first carried on Wednesday) 
By Linda Sieg 
TOKYO, Jan 1 (Reuters) - Carlos Ghosn’s daring flight from Japan, where he was awaiting trial on charges of financial wrongdoing, has revived global criticism of the nation’s “hostage justice,” but i… [+3205 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Treasury's Mnunchin to head U.S. delegation to Davos conclave
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will lead a group of U.S. officials who will attend the World Economic Forum later this month in Davos, Switzerland, the White House said Wednesday.'
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin will lead a group of U.S. officials who will attend the World Economic Forum later this month in Davos, Switzerland, the White House said Wednesday. 
Mnunchin will be joined by officials including… [+1532 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South Korea December factory activity returns to growth as export orders expand most in 18 months: PMI
articles.description: South Korea's factory activity returned to growth in December, snapping seven straight months of contraction, helped by improving demand, especially from abroad, a private business survey showed on Thursday.'
articles.content:
SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea’s factory activity returned to growth in December, snapping seven straight months of contraction, helped by improving demand, especially from abroad, a private business survey showed on Thursday. 
The Nikkei/Markit purchasing ma… [+1924 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Singapore economy expands 0.7% in 2019, slowest in a decade
articles.description: Singapore's economy expanded at its slowest pace in a decade last year as the manufacturing sector struggled, preliminary data showed on Thursday, even though growth picked up slightly in the fourth quarter.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE(Reuters) - Singapore’s economy expanded at its slowest pace in a decade last year as the manufacturing sector struggled, preliminary data showed on Thursday, even though growth picked up slightly in the fourth quarter. 
The export-oriented economy … [+1398 chars]
